Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: University of Madras
Review: university of Madras is one of the oldest university and proud got my postgraudation through this university. Is is located nearer to  Marina beach and with vast area. Different departments, library etc are functioning here.  I too worked as a part time employee, during my college days

Name: ST_INDIA
Title: One of the oldest university in India
Review: This is one of the oldest university in India which is situated right opposite to the Marina beach and the building is like ones of the British era. This is surely the most prestigious university in Tamil Nadu one of the most popular ones in India.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: onemore British era building
Review: This is one of the famous universities of the state and so vast with beautiful building,nice garden, and is overlooking the sea.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Nice University
Review: I happened to visit this place due to my friend who was studying there earlier. This university has a long history of education.Nice campus.

Name: vasan224
Title: public state university
Review: it was established in 1857, it is one of the oldest and premier universities in India.It is a collegiate research university and has six campuses in the city viz., Chepauk, Marina, Guindy, Taramani, Maduravoyal and Chetpet. At present, there are 73 academic departments grouped under 18 schools, covering diverse areas such as sciences, social sciences, humanities, management and medicine along with 109 affiliated colleges and 52 approved research institutions.

Name: vijmail99
Title: Huge campus
Review: Huge campus and a prestigious institution. But foul smell due to the sewage flow nearby. Lot of trees. Prepare for a lot of walking.

Name: s_ramsam
Title: British legacy
Review: This landmark building in Chennai presently housing the university is a lovely legacy of the British era. Fine architecture and well located facing the sprawling Marina beach.

Name: James H
Title: Excellent Architecture
Review: This is a huge rambling place to visit. It is one of the oldest universities in India (chartered in 1857) and it is a glorious collection of Indo-Saracenic architecture. I gave a talk here on my last visit and had the chance to poke into some of the incredible buildings. Do try to find Senate House if you have the time and image what it was like it its heyday.  It is lovely place for a stroll anytime. Perhaps a bit tatty around the edges but it has that magical sense of former students over the ages.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Oldest University in India
Review: One of the oldest and prestigious institute in India for education, offers lots of courses - UG & PG and many colleges are affiliated to this. Located near Marina Beach,

Name: Anusuya D
Title: landmark at chennai
Review: old building of educational institutions. landmark at chennai , situated at beach road. santuary for students.

Name: krish862
Title: one of the oldest temple for education
Review: The university is world famous and very old . Even the construction , we can see best architecture available in those good olden days..Present maintainance is not good

Name: Perry Grinate
Title: must see for fans of Indo-Saracenic architecture
Review: Robert Chisholm's Senate House is breathtaking from the outside.  Walk inside (no-one stopped me) and a desolate picture of an interior populated only by birds opens up.  Other Indo-saracenic buildings to visit (I hired a tuk tuk for a morning for 800 rupees and did a round trip) are the railway station, Ripon Building, Victoria Hall and Bharat Insurance Building

Name: Jothilingam E
Title: Very old university
Review: One of the oldest universities in India and also in Asia.This is in beach road and opposite to famous marina beach,government office,many memorials like leaders,Anna,MGR,Jayalilitha etc.The university offers many cources and do not to visit library and university centenary hall where all convocations happen

Name: balakec
Title: Best Place to checkout the Indo-Sarcenic Architecture
Review: Madras University is one of the oldest universities of Asia. The place is opposite to the Marina Beach. The campus has loads of colonial era red brick buildings. Special mention to the Senate House which is designed in Indo-Sarcenic architectures which blends both native indian along with persian(mughal) architecture.

Name: Shankar N
Title: Visit it for the building style
Review: Though this is an educational institution, i like it because of its architecture.  Old buildings built in the colonial style.. long walkways.. high ceiling and cool interiors..

Name: Ameet_Pathare
Title: Colonial Charm..!
Review: Located opposite marina beach the grandeur of university cannot be described.The majestic architecture buildings have their own charm.Visitors are not allowed to enter the premises

Name: Mohan2013
Title: Memorable place
Review: Situated on the marina beach, the second longest and most beautiful beach of the world. The seat of education that produced great scholars snd administrators. A very old building and one of the oldest varieties in India. Proud to be a student of tbd university.

Name: ganeshpkumar
Title: Huge and grand structures
Review: Located just opposite to the marina beach, this University is a testimony to the architectural influence of the British Rule. The place covers a vast area with beautiful buildings and trees. The sad part is that they are not much well maintained.

Name: YatriForever
Title: Old, colonial buildings
Review: Having been a student of this once prestigious University, it is sad to see  the poor upkeep of these amazing heritage buildings. Unfortunately, not many in the University's administration can explain/answer specific questions about the legacy of these grand structures. Just a ice place to visit, if you happen to be in Marina Beach.

Name: NafiRiz
Title: More than a century old
Review: This red colored, historic colonial architecture is a beautiful educational campus. Its a big property and is surrounded by loads n loads of trees. It is opposite to the marina beach.

Name: Unni2006
Title: University of Madras
Review: This is one of the oldest universities at chennai which offers all variety of specialisations. . Located on the Marina Beach Road , it normally confuses the public between Anna University at Guindy and the University of Madras. Beautiful old architecture is another attraction over here. Very popular among the local people.

Name: Arrul
Title: Senate building is the one to look for!!!1
Review: Senate building,one of the beautiful and  considered to be one of the best and oldest examples of Indo-Saracenic architecture in India.

Name: AshokMela
Title: Prestigious University !!
Review: University of Madras commonly referred as Madras University is located opposite to Marina beach. This is one of the biggest and oldest university in southern India. The colonial architecture depicts the same. The campus has some very big trees that me be couple of centuries old.

Name: Karthik V
Title: Oldest and Prestigious University
Review: The University of Madras is One of the Oldest and Prestigious University in Chennai. Its majestic structure overlooking the long Marina Beach and the pristine blue waters is wonderful to see and study its architure.

Name: Shyamis
Title: A very old university and a good place to visit
Review: Love visiting the university campus every once in a while. The library is good, The buildings are really old and interesting and in general it is a nice place to visit

Name: Pulak
Title: Colonial Architecture at its Best
Review: Located very close to Marina Beach, the University of Madras building is an architectural marvel. Visited from outside and felt very impressed

Name: Je L
Title: Good University
Review: This university is located by a beautiful beach.  You can enjoy the beach and visit this university.  It is also historical place.

Name: andrewwray2512
Title: Stunning colonial architecture
Review: It's definitely worth strolling along to the University of Madras to take a peek at the stunning colonial architecture set amongst leafy grounds by the beach. The security guards will probably try to stop you taking photos, (for unknown reasons), but it's worth the hassle even just to look.

Name: vidyutm
Title: nice landscape
Review: University of madras located opposite Marina beach of chennai. you can see historic building of this educational campus.

Name: Bhargava Krishna
Title: Historical University
Review: Almost 120 years aged building. Impressive look. Near to marina beach. Many great scientists and film makers studied here.

Name: bigbobadams
Title: Cool Old Buildings Near Marina Beach
Review: This is a university, so not really a tourist attraction for visitors. There are some really cool old buildings on campus with the classic British architecture. It is right across the Anna Memorial and northern starting point of Marina Beach.

Name: Mathivanan V
Title: Very old British Structure
Review: Built by British Governor ,It is very good to look from outside but it is really pathetic once you are in.Anyone visiting Marina beach can see this marvel from outside  even click a snap or two.If you don't have any other work you can step inside and visit the Library.A very good library to spend some time.And nothing else it offers.

Name: SagarVS
Title: Not for the visitor
Review: Unless you have business here, there is no need to enter the place. If you are visiting the marina  beach you could take a look at the impressive building from outside.

Name: Neeraj P
Title: Nice place!
Review: An age old university, which has given some of the best minds to the country!! Location is also very nice.. A must visit, even if u cant study here.

Name: VinodKV
Title: a good place to visit if you are interested in education in chennai
Review: this is an old institution of learning in chennai. known for its ancient culture and alumni, this institute is famed for its heritage.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Madras University .
Review: Age old institution , colonial buildings , got lots of streams of education for correspondence students also .

Name: kathiranand7
Title: Nice
Review: Madras university is one of the most important university this is nice place to study very good ....

Name: madhubarwa
Title: Beachyyyy view
Review: I just was exploring since it was close to the marina beach.....wish i was a student there. I would take my books and study sitting by the beach ...air blowing my hair......

Name: ravikumartalara
Title: old university in  madras
Review: very ancient and historical university...so many popular studied here..very near to marina..you can cool breeze of marina

Name: sundarjagalan
Title: Oldest University
Review: this place is bang opposite to MGR memorial at marina beach. U can visit this place from  outside, good British architecture style building and it is  one of the very old University in India

Name: kevinjohn1991
Title: Old University in Chennai!!
Review: It is one of the oldest universities in India. The campus is extremely beautiful and houses one of the larger libraries in Chennai. The univeristy has a host of notable alumni as well!!!

Name: mendapara
Title: OLDEST UNIVERSITY
Review: University is very old and very well maintained. Campus of University of Madras is very beautiful. Library at University of Madras is one of the large library in tamilnadu.

Name: Raju L
Title: Oldest building par excellence!
Review: Recently, I had to visit the University of Madras to obtain the transcripts of my son-in-law and I started reminiscing the beauty of the buildings. As an alumni of the same University, though I had come several times before as a student, I did not admire the excellence of the architectural aspects then & I took the opportunity to leisurely view the building during the waiting time I spent before getting the transcripts in hand.I would like to thank the University for the speedy processing of transcripts within the same day.

Name: rockspeeder
Title: must see during visit of marina beach
Review: Situated along the beach road, Huge grounds with old structures is a perfect photo place.One of several campus of University of Madras and located opposite the Marina Beach, is worth of a visit before going to the beach. Take a walk inside the campus, get a taste of the university's atmosphere, and visit the photo exhibition in the Senate building.

Name: Lakshmi R
Title: Worth Visiting
Review: It is just opposite to Marina Beach. Must visit Senat hall. The architecture of the building have a nice British touch to it.

Name: Valluri Mukesh Krishna
Title: Nice Architecture and Photographers Dream
Review: Excellent Architecture and Lovely Place for a Photoshoot.. Visitors not allowed inside..But it's a very reputed University..

Name: Ajay S
Title: Love Architecture and Knowledge. Go there
Review: If you love Architecture and Knowledge, visit this place. Excellent place to walk around and look at old schools. Eat at the canteen, for some authentic 'college students food' :)

Name: GuelphTraveller
Title: Important Architecture in Chennai
Review: You can walk onto Oxford University and Harvard and virtually any university in the world as a tourist and take pictures but not the University of Madras. You can photograph from the street but the trees make it difficult. This restriction on photography is a serious obstacle for tourists and researchers in India. However the Senate building is an important Indo-Sarcenic building which is a Victorian picturesque style with blended Italian and Sarcenic designs. It is the masdterpiece of architect Robert Chisholm and was completed in 1873. In addition the Presidency College which gave photo permission is also on site and is another good example of the style. There are other interesting buildings in the area including the crumbling remains of the Chepauk Palace (1768) once the home of the Nawab of Arcot.

Name: tsashi
Title: Old building, nice to photograph
Review: Situated along the beach road, this old establishment is a must for anyone who loves buildings. Huge grounds with old structures is a perfect photo place.

Name: Bornav
Title: Visitors not allowed inside
Review: The main university campus with historic colonial buildings located by the seaside looks impressive from outside. However, visitors are not allowed to enter the premises. This area is relatively peaceful in the evening for a walk by the sea.

Name: Mikael S
Title: Historic place of education
Review: One of several campus of University of Madras and located opposite the Marina Beach, is worth of a visit before going to the beach. Take a walk inside the campus, get a taste of the university's atmosphere, and visit the photo exhibition in the Senate building. Adjacent to the exhibition there's University of Madras' Bookshop in which a illustrative book about University's history and architecture is available.

Name: bsp2010
Title: Oldest & best
Review: I have done my MBA in Madras University (also called University of Madras) during 84-86. We have celebrated 25 years silver jubilee last year. For last 2 years, I am a regular visitor. Many of our batch students and seniors and juniors are at very high positions (directors, president, vice president, etc ) across the industries. This simply proved that the university is really excellent.

Name: dksud
Title: Senate Hall - Marvelous architect, fantastic history
Review: Madras University, established in 1857, must be one of the oldest Universities of India. I just happened to view the dome of Madras University's Senate Hall from across the MGR Samadhi at Marina Beach and was immediately attracted by beautiful domes painted with vibrant colors. I am glad that I walked through the subway to this great monument.The architect from outside is so captivating that I took numerous rounds of the Hall to capture it in my camera from various angles. From the outside the architect dominated by domes appears Islamic. But from inside, there is a complete transformation in style. With its tainted glasses, curved walls, long pillars, painted ceiling and a podium, it can pass as a beautiful Catholic church. Carvings of Hindu gods and godesses  on the columns at the entrance compliment the architect blend.Architect alone is not the only attraction. There is a permanent exhibition of documents, photographs and  paintings depicting not only the history of Madras University but also history of education institutes starting from 11th Century.Some of most important documents display the curriculum, salary paid to teachers and allowance paid to students during height of Chola dynasty in South.Building and its surroundings can do with some improvement is house keeping. I would rate it the best toursit attraction of Chennai after Mahabalipuram.

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: Artificially natural!
Review: The East India Company (and the British Government) should be attributed to the grand architecture that stands tall for more than a century. The University is diagonally opposite to the world-famous Marina beach. But my favourite area is the library which I've been visiting regularly for the past two decades. You can enjoy the melodious music of humming birds if you get an opportunity to sit on the corridor of the library around six in the evening. The sound of waves is also heard at times. Highly recommended for nature lovers!

Name: arul_nambi2000
Title: One of the govts. pride
Review: The buildings are quite beautiful and full of architectural marvels. The ambiance can be created only in govt. institutions with lots of trees and space to move around. The buildings stands still good with less maintenance. Govt to think of making this also as a tourist spot making the museum live

Name: Rasheed I
Title: Bureaucratic and unhelpful
Review: Typical government attitudes where the staff believe they are doing you a favour for everything. Vast campus and much walking to be done with no helpful boards or signs to indicate what is available where.

Name: Sindhu N
Title: I am student of University of Madras
Review: I am student of University of Madras, so in relation to all my degrees I used to visit this place regularly till 2005... after that also I have visited this place many times till 2010...

Name: rprabhoo
Title: Citadel of Learning
Review: Even in today's crass commercial world, University provides quality education and research facilities in all spheres of life.

Name: Abhishek
Title: Nothing to see here
Review: Its a Old Running University. If you visit this place then you can only see the Architecture, University Stuffs, a few Students and their Guardians there. Nothing more. Very close to Marina Beach and Chepauk.
